name: Duchies of Vinci
background:
The Duchies of Vinci are an army of highly advanced Humans assisted by their robotic automatons. On the battlefield, they rely on ranged warfare using crossbows and cannons, supported by the more resilient Automa. 

They were once a collection of poor villages who discovered the intelligence-enhancing Mindstones in the aftermath of the Rift. The Vinci have gained great wealth and knowledge, but guard their secrets and their Mindstones closely to protect themselves from poverty. However, over time, their isolationism has fostered rivalry between the Duchies, causing them to stagnate.
backgroundFull:
The Vinci were once amongst the poorest people in Tyria, a meagre collection of villages built on swampland. Without any source of wealth, they were subsistence farmers who were largely disregarded by the wider Empire and other outsiders as mere peasants. 

When the Great Rift opened, the Vinci’s homelands were devastated by violent earthquakes. Soon after these quakes, however, glowing stones began to emerge from the depths of the swamps. At first, the stones were simply used to create jewellery, but soon the stones started to affect people’s minds and made them smarter, leading to a new time of technological and cultural progress. They became known as Mindstones soon after, and it was not long before the Vinci had taken every stone that they could find until almost none remained undiscovered. 

Influenced by their Mindstones, the Vinci started building machines to drain the swamps and reclaim the land. They expanded their farmland, built great cities, and became very rich, very quickly. The Vinci established universities that attracted the best minds in all the land, which led to the invention of robots known as Automa. These robots assisted the Vinci with farming, construction, and generally served to boost the advancement of the Vinci even more. 

As the Vinci began to prosper, they found themselves surrounded by enemies. Outsiders sought to claim these newfound riches for themselves and began to stake claims upon the Vinci and their Mindstones. When conflict broke out, the Vinci armies turned the tides and soon conquered their neighbours.

In order to defend themselves from future conflicts, the Vinci turned their cities into fortresses and expelled all foreign diplomats and scholars. The isolated Duchies became even more reliant on advanced technology to make up for their losses in trade. Now, Universities are the real power in Vinci, while Dukes have become mere figureheads. This led to them being highly insular and suspicious, with their universities waging secret wars of sabotage and espionage on each other. 

How will you ensure the prosperity of your duchy?

spells.name: Neurotoxin Gas
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 6 hits with AP(1) and Shred.

specialRules.name: Fortified
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule take hits, those hits count as having AP(-1), to a min. of AP(0).

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Precise
specialRules.description: Gets +1 to hit when attacking.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter
specialRules.description: When in melee, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Ignores Cover
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores cover.

specialRules.name: Vinci Tech
specialRules.description: When this unit is activated, pick one effect: until the end of the activation all models with this rule in it either get AP(+1) when attacking, or get +1 to hit rolls when attacking.

specialRules.name: Unique
specialRules.description: This unit may only be taken once per army.

specialRules.name: Takedown Strike
specialRules.description: Once per game, when it's this model's turn to attack in melee, you may pick one model in the unit as its target, and make one attack at Quality 2+ with AP(2) and Deadly(3), which is resolved as if it's a unit of 1.

specialRules.name: Armor
specialRules.description: Counts as having Defense X+.

specialRules.name: Protected
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 6+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Repel Ambushers
specialRules.description: Enemy units using Ambush must be set up over 12" away from this model's unit.

specialRules.name: Heavy Impact
specialRules.description: Counts as having Impact(X) with hits that have AP(1).

specialRules.name: Crossing Barrage
specialRules.description: Once per activation, when this model moves through enemy units, pick one of them and roll X dice. For each 4+ it takes 3 hits with AP(1).

specialRules.name: Shielded
specialRules.description: Units where all models have this rule get +1 to defense rolls against hits that are not from spells.

specialRules.name: Ranged Slayer Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Ranged Slayer.

specialRules.name: Mend
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one friendly model within 3" with Tough, and remove D3 wounds from it.

specialRules.name: Melee Slayer
specialRules.description: This model's melee weapons get AP(+2) against units where most models have Tough(3) or higher.

specialRules.name: Decimate
specialRules.description: Ignores Cover, and against units where most models have Defense 2+ to Defense 3+, this weapon gets AP(+2).

specialRules.name: Unstoppable in Melee Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Unstoppable in melee.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Shooter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Unpredictable Shooter.

specialRules.name: Bane in Melee
specialRules.description: This model gets Bane in melee.

specialRules.name: Fortified Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Fortified.

specialRules.name: Surge
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, this weapon deals 1 extra hits (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Vinci Tech Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Vinci Tech Boost.

specialRules.name: Precision Shooting Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one enemy unit within 18", which friendly units get +1 to hit rolls when shooting against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Increased Shooting Range Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one enemy unit within 18", which friendly units get +6" range when shooting against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Precision Spotter
specialRules.description: Once per activation, pick one enemy unit within 36" and in line of sight of this model and roll one die, on a 4+ place a marker on it. Friendly units may remove markers from their target before rolling to hit to get +X to hit rolls when attacking, where X is the number of removed markers.

specialRules.name: Re-Position Artillery
specialRules.description: Once per activation, pick one friendly model within 6" with Artillery, which may immediately move by up to 9".

specialRules.name: Rapid Advance Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Rapid Advance.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Deadly
specialRules.description: Assign each wound to one model, and multiply it by X. Hits from Deadly must be resolved first, and these wounds don’t carry over to other models if the original target is killed.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9” away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush can’t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Impact
specialRules.description: Roll X dice when attacking after charging, unless fatigued. For each 2+ the target takes one hit.

specialRules.name: Slayer
specialRules.description: This model's weapons get AP(+2) against units where most models have Tough(3) or higher.

specialRules.name: Ranged Slayer
specialRules.description: This model's ranged weapons get AP(+2) against units where most models have Tough(3) or higher.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model must take X wounds before being killed. If a model with tough joins a unit without it, then it is removed last when the unit takes wounds. You must continue to put wounds on the tough model with most wounds in the unit until it is killed, before starting to put them on the next tough model (heroes must be assigned wounds last, even if already wounded).

specialRules.name: Unstoppable
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and ignores all negative modifiers to this weapon.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable
specialRules.description: When attacking, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Shooter
specialRules.description: When shooting, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Bane
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and when attacking the target must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6.

specialRules.name: Vinci Tech Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Vinci Tech, it always gets both AP(+1) and +1 to hit rolls from Vinci Tech (instead of having to pick between AP(+1) or +1 to hit rolls).

specialRules.name: Artillery
specialRules.description: May only use Hold actions. When this model shoots at enemies over 9" away, it gets +1 to hit rolls. When enemy units shoot at this model from over 9" away, they get -2 to hit rolls.

specialRules.name: Rapid Advance
specialRules.description: This model moves +4" when using Advance actions.

specialRules.name: Steadfast
specialRules.description: If a unit where all models have this rule is Shaken at the beginning of the round, roll one die. On a 4+, it stops being Shaken.

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.
